description: The Poseidon_IDs this sequencing entity corresponds to, from the Janno-file, multiple entries separated by ;
The kind of UDG treatment applied to the library for this sequencing entity
The library preparation method applied for this sequencing entity (single- or double-stranded)
The sample accession code as used in INSDC databases, including ENA and SRA (Example: SAMEA7050454)
The study accession code as used in INSDC databases, including ENA and SRA (Example: PRJEB39316)
The run accession code as used in INSDC databases, including ENA and SRA (Example: ERR4331996). This should be a unique identifier in most cases
The sample alias defined by the submitter
A secondary sample accession, as used at the ENA for historical reasons (Example: ERS4811084)
The date (YYYY-MM-DD) this sample was first made public
The date (YYYY-MM-DD) this sample was last updated
The name of the instrument used (Example: Illumina HiSeq 2500)
The library layout of the sequencing entity (Example: SINGLE)
The source of the DNA library (Example: GENOMIC)
The platform brand or type of the sequencer (Example: ILLUMINA)

The ID of the library. Defaults to the library name the submitter has entered to the raw sequencing data repository. Data entries across which optical duplicates could exist should have matching library names. Can sometimes be useful to figure out which Poseidon_ID this entity belongs to.
The strategy used to create the library (Example: WGS)
The FTP-link(s) (URL) to the FASTQ file(s) (Example: ftp.sra.ebi.ac.uk/vol1/fastq/ERR433/009/ERR4332639/ERR4332639.fastq.gz)
The Aspera-link (URL) to the FASTQ-file(s). (Example: fasp.sra.ebi.ac.uk:/vol1/fastq/ERR433/009/ERR4332639/ERR4332639.fastq.gz)
The number of bytes of the FASTQ-file(s) in bytes
The MD5 hash(es) of the FASTQ-file(s)
The number of reads
The URL(s) to the originally submitted file(s) before it got converted to FASTQ. This can sometimes be helpful for processing
